[Home](./index.md) &gt; [@here/harp-geoutils](./harp-geoutils.md) &gt; [Projection](./harp-geoutils.projection.md)

## Projection class

`Projection` is used to convert positions from geo coordinates to world coordinates and vice versa.

<b>Signature:</b>

```typescript
export declare abstract class Projection 
```

## Constructors

|  Constructor | Modifiers | Description |
|  --- | --- | --- |
|  [(constructor)(unitScale)](./harp-geoutils.projection._constructor_.md) |  | Constructs the Projection |

## Properties

|  Property | Modifiers | Type | Description |
|  --- | --- | --- | --- |
|  [type](./harp-geoutils.projection.type.md) |  | [ProjectionType](./harp-geoutils.projectiontype.md) | The type of this \[Projection\]. |
|  [unitScale](./harp-geoutils.projection.unitscale.md) |  | number |  |

## Methods

|  Method | Modifiers | Description |
|  --- | --- | --- |
|  [getScaleFactor(worldPoint)](./harp-geoutils.projection.getscalefactor.md) |  | Returns the scaling factor that must be used to convert the units used by <code>worldPoint</code> to meters. |
|  [groundDistance(worldPoint)](./harp-geoutils.projection.grounddistance.md) |  | Returns the signed distance between the given coordinates and the closest point on the surface. |
|  [localTangentSpace(point, result)](./harp-geoutils.projection.localtangentspace.md) |  | Gets the \[\[TransformLike\]\] of the local tangent space at the given point. |
|  [projectBox(geoBox)](./harp-geoutils.projection.projectbox.md) |  | Projects bounds in geo coordinates to a bounding box in world coordinates.<!-- -->Example:
```typescript
const bounds = projection.projectBox(geoBox);
console.log(bounds.min, bounds.max);

```
 |
|  [projectBox(geoBox, result)](./harp-geoutils.projection.projectbox_1.md) |  | Projects bounds in geo coordinates to a bounding box in world coordinates.<!-- -->Example:
```typescript
const bounds = projection.projectBox(geoBox, new THREE.Box3());
console.log(bounds.min, bounds.max);

```
 |
|  [projectPoint(geoPoint, result)](./harp-geoutils.projection.projectpoint.md) |  | Projects a point from geo coordinates (latitude, longitude, altitude) to world coordinates (x,y,z).<!-- -->Example:
```typescript
const worldPos = new THREE.Vector3();
projection.projectPoint(geoPos, worldPos);

```
 |
|  [reprojectPoint(sourceProjection, worldPos)](./harp-geoutils.projection.reprojectpoint.md) |  | Reproject a world position from the given source \[\[Projection\]\]. |
|  [reprojectPoint(sourceProjection, worldPos, result)](./harp-geoutils.projection.reprojectpoint_1.md) |  | Reproject a world position from the given source \[\[Projection\]\]. |
|  [scalePointToSurface(worldPoint)](./harp-geoutils.projection.scalepointtosurface.md) |  | Scales the given world coordinates to the surface. |
|  [surfaceNormal(worldPoint)](./harp-geoutils.projection.surfacenormal.md) |  | Returns the surface normal at the given world position. |
|  [surfaceNormal(worldPoint, result)](./harp-geoutils.projection.surfacenormal_1.md) |  | Returns the surface normal at the given world position. |
|  [unprojectAltitude(worldPoint)](./harp-geoutils.projection.unprojectaltitude.md) |  | Returns the altitude at the given world position (x,y,z) in meters. |
|  [unprojectBox(worldBox)](./harp-geoutils.projection.unprojectbox.md) |  | Converts a bounding box in world coordinates to a bounding box in geo coordinates.<!-- -->Example:
```typescript
const geoPos = projection.unprojectPoint(worldPos);
console.log(geoPos.latitude, geoPos.longitude, geoPos.altitude);

```
 |
|  [unprojectPoint(worldPoint)](./harp-geoutils.projection.unprojectpoint.md) |  | Returns the geo coordinates (latitude, longitude, altitude) from the given world position (x,y,z).<!-- -->Example:
```typescript
const geoPos = projection.unprojectPoint(worldPos);
console.log(geoPos.latitude, geoPos.longitude, geoPos.altitude);

```
 |
|  [worldExtent(minElevation, maxElevation, result)](./harp-geoutils.projection.worldextent.md) |  | Returns the world extents in world coordinates. |
